Workflow

Your compass to innovation and design excellence. From exploration to execution, this dynamic framework fuels creativity and precision, ensuring your product journey aligns seamlessly with user desires

DISCOVER

Brainstorming sessions in order to take their needs and company goals into account.

In modern businesses, brainstorming sessions play a crucial role in understanding the needs and goals of a company. During these collaborative meetings, team members come together to share ideas, insights, and perspectives, fostering an environment where creativity can thrive. The process typically begins with defining the key objectives and challenges the organization faces. Next, participants articulate their thoughts, encouraging an open dialogue where all contributions are valued. Techniques such as mind mapping or free association can help stimulate discussion and generate a diverse range of solutions. As the session progresses, ideas are evaluated and refined, aligning them with the companyâ€™s strategic vision. Ultimately, these collaborative efforts not only enhance problem-solving capabilities but also ensure that the companyâ€™s goals are effectively addressed, paving the way for innovation and growth.

DEFINE

Unlock invaluable insights into your ideal client, capitalize on market opportunities, and elevate your design sprint to unprecedented levels of success.

To effectively tailor your offerings, itâ€™s essential to gather comprehensive information about your ideal client. This involves understanding their needs, behaviors, and the challenges they face. Conducting surveys, interviews, and market research can help identify key characteristics that define your target audience. Additionally, analyzing market opportunities enables you to pinpoint gaps in the market where your services can provide significant value. Engaging in design sprints allows for rapid prototyping and testing of ideas, ensuring that your solutions are aligned with client expectations and requirements. This iterative process not only fosters innovation but also enhances collaboration among cross-functional teams, ultimately leading to a more refined product that meets market demands.

DEVELOP

Defining the user experience and analyzing your designs will shape user behavior and enhance the overall experience for users. 

Defining the user experience and analyzing your designs is crucial for shaping user behavior and enhancing the overall experience. A thoughtful approach to user-centric design involves understanding the needs and preferences of your users, which can be achieved through user testing and feedback. By iterating on your designs based on this feedback, you create a more intuitive interface that encourages positive interactions. Additionally, utilizing analytics tools can help track user engagement and pinpoint areas for improvement. This continuous cycle of design, analysis, and refinement not only improves usability but also fosters customer loyalty and satisfaction, ultimately leading to a successful product.

item.title: Ally Opens New State-of-the-Art Seattle Headquarters
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Ally Financial has officially unveiled its brand-new Seattle headquarters in the bustling South Lake Union district, marking a significant milestone in the companyâ€™s strategic expansion on the West Coast. Occupying 25,000 square feet across two state-of-the-art floors in a LEED-certified high-rise, the facility is designed to foster collaboration, creativity, and rapid innovation. From open-concept workspaces and quiet focus pods to dedicated â€œInnovation Labsâ€ equipped with the latest in prototyping technology, every element of the new office reflects Allyâ€™s commitment to empowering employees and delivering cutting-edge digital banking solutions.

The choice of Seattle was driven by the cityâ€™s reputation as a global technology hub and its deep talent pool of software engineers, product designers, and data scientists. â€œSeattle offers an unparalleled ecosystem of tech expertise and entrepreneurial spirit,â€ said Maria Thompson, Allyâ€™s Vice President of Corporate Development. â€œBy establishing a physical presence here, weâ€™re better positioned to attract top talent, partner with local universities like the University of Washington, and engage directly with startups and established tech leaders.â€

Sustainability and employee wellness are core themes throughout the headquarters. Energy-efficient LED lighting and smart climate controls reduce the buildingâ€™s carbon footprint, while reclaimed wood furnishings and living â€œgreen wallsâ€ enhance indoor air quality and create a warm, natural aesthetic. The rooftop terrace, complete with native plants and shaded seating areas, provides a tranquil retreat for informal meetings or a moment of pause during the workday. Additionally, the office includes fully equipped fitness studios, meditation rooms, and ergonomic workstations, underscoring Allyâ€™s holistic approach to work-life balance.

In line with its customer-centric philosophy, Ally has incorporated advanced customer experience centers into the Seattle location. These centers feature immersive video conferencing suites where clients can engage in real-time consultations with financial advisors, explore interactive demos of Allyâ€™s latest mobile and web-based tools, and attend virtual workshops on topics ranging from retirement planning to cybersecurity best practices. By situating these facilities alongside engineering and product teams, Ally aims to shorten feedback loops and accelerate the refinement of its digital offerings.

The grand opening on May 27, 2025, was celebrated with a ribbon-cutting ceremony attended by Seattle mayoral representatives, local chamber of commerce officials, and members of the Pacific Northwest tech community. Attendees toured the workspace, witnessed live demonstrations of Allyâ€™s AI-driven budgeting assistant, and joined panel discussions on the evolving regulatory landscape for fintech. As part of its community commitment, Ally pledged a $100,000 grant to support STEM education initiatives in underrepresented neighborhoods, partnering with local nonprofits to deliver coding workshops and financial literacy programs for high school students.

Looking forward, the Seattle hub will serve as the pilot location for several breakthrough initiatives. Ally plans to beta-test its next-generation AI financial coachâ€”a tool that leverages machine learning to deliver personalized savings and investment recommendationsâ€”in real-world scenarios. The company will also expand its business banking team in Seattle, offering small and mid-sized enterprises access to streamlined loan underwriting powered by proprietary data-analytics models. By integrating customer support, product development, and community outreach under one roof, Ally anticipates faster product iterations and deeper market insights.

As digital transformation continues to reshape the financial services industry, Allyâ€™s new Seattle headquarters stands as a testament to the companyâ€™s agility and forward-thinking culture. â€œOur mission is to revolutionize banking through technology and transparency,â€ said Thompson. â€œThis office embodies those principlesâ€”bringing together the brightest minds in fintech, fostering an environment where creativity thrives, and staying rooted in the communities we serve.â€

With operations now fully underway in Seattle, Ally is poised to strengthen its West Coast presence, drive innovation in digital banking, and deepen its engagement with the Pacific Northwestâ€™s dynamic tech ecosystem. The new headquarters not only reinforces Allyâ€™s vision of a more accessible and personalized financial future but also signals the companyâ€™s long-term commitment to sustainable growth and community partnership.
item.excerpt:encoded: Ally, the leading fintech innovator, has inaugurated a cutting-edge office in Seattle to deepen its West Coast footprint, foster collaboration with the local tech ecosystem, and deliver exceptional client experiences.

item.title: Ally Launches Cutting-Edge Innovation Hub in Chicago
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Designed to be both collaborative and adaptable, the space features modular workstations, â€œwar roomsâ€ for rapid prototyping sprints, and interactive demo studios where clients and partners can experience Allyâ€™s latest digital banking capabilities in real time.

Chicago was selected for its dynamic tech ecosystem and central access to top universities like Northwestern and the University of Chicago. â€œThis hub is more than just an officeâ€”itâ€™s a catalyst for co-innovation,â€ said Raj Patel, Allyâ€™s Senior Director of Technology Partnerships. â€œBy embedding ourselves in Chicagoâ€™s vibrant startup scene and academic community, we aim to accelerate the development of solutions that anticipate the evolving needs of our customers.â€ To that end, Ally has already announced collaborations with local incubators to host quarterly fintech hackathons and mentor early-stage ventures focused on inclusive finance.

Sustainability and employee well-being are woven into every aspect of the Chicago hub. The buildingâ€™s restored brick facade and exposed timber beams pay homage to its industrial heritage, while a state-of-the-art HVAC system and solar-reflective roofing minimize energy consumption. Indoor air quality sensors automatically adjust ventilation, and recycled-glass countertops accent communal kitchen areas. Employees can recharge in the â€œWellness Loft,â€ which includes sound-proof meditation pods, adjustable standing desks, and a fitness nook stocked with lightweight exercise equipment.

A standout feature is the â€œClient Experience Theater,â€ where visitorsâ€”ranging from small-business owners to institutional partnersâ€”engage in immersive sessions facilitated by Allyâ€™s advisors. Using augmented-reality overlays and live analytics dashboards, attendees can explore personalized financial scenarios, such as cash-flow optimization or retirement planning, in an interactive environment. Integrating this client-centric approach alongside the engineering teams creates a continuous feedback loop, speeding up product refinements and user-driven enhancements.

To commemorate the launch, Ally hosted a public-private reception on June 10, 2025, featuring remarks by Chicagoâ€™s Commissioner of Economic Development and Ally CEO Jeffrey Brown. The event also showcased demos of Allyâ€™s AI-powered â€œSpending Insightsâ€ tool and its upcoming small-business lending portal. In alignment with its community commitment, Ally pledged a $150,000 grant to Chicagoâ€™s public schools to expand financial literacy curricula and sponsor coding workshops for underrepresented youth.

Looking ahead, the Chicago hub will pilot several next-generation initiatives, including voice-activated banking assistants and blockchain-enabled escrow services. By merging Chicagoâ€™s heritage of innovation with Allyâ€™s agile development model, the new hub is positioned to deliver breakthrough financial solutions that empower customers across the Midwest and beyond.
item.excerpt:encoded: Ally Financial has expanded its innovation network with the grand opening of a new hub in Chicagoâ€™s historic Fulton Market district. The 30,000-square-foot facility, spanning three floors of a repurposed loft building, brings together cross-functional teams of engineers, UX designers, data scientists, and financial strategists under one roof.

item.title: New Customer Service Center in Miami
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Miamiâ€™s strategic importance lies in its diverse, bilingual workforce and its role as a gateway to Latin American and Caribbean markets. â€œEstablishing our Customer Service Center in Miami allows us to serve a broader range of clients in both English and Spanish, reflecting the multicultural communities we support,â€ said Elena Rodriguez, Vice President of Customer Operations. â€œThis center embodies our promise of empathetic, high-quality service delivered with cultural fluency.â€

The design prioritizes flexibility and well-being. Open-plan seating pods are complemented by sound-dampening partitions to ensure privacy during sensitive calls. The center includes â€œQuiet Zonesâ€ for focused work and â€œCollaboration Loungesâ€ where teams can huddle over complex cases or conduct training sessions. Ergonomic chairs, adjustable lighting, and access to green-roof terraces overlooking Biscayne Bay contribute to a healthier work environment.

Technology integration is a hallmark of the Miami center. AI-enhanced voice-analysis tools monitor real-time sentiment and suggest tailored responses, while an intelligent routing system directs inquiries to the most qualified specialistsâ€”whether the query pertains to auto loan refinancing, digital wallet troubleshooting, or merchant services. A dedicated analytics wing aggregates performance metrics and customer feedback, enabling continuous service improvements.

To inaugurate the new center on June 15, 2025, Ally hosted a community open house featuring tours, live agent demonstrations, and panels on the future of customer experience in finance. Miamiâ€™s Deputy Mayor and local business leaders attended, emphasizing the centerâ€™s role in creating hundreds of new jobs. As part of its civic engagement, Ally committed $75,000 to Miami-Dadeâ€™s nonprofit workforce development programs, offering scholarships for call-center training and digital literacy courses.

Looking forward, the Miami Customer Service Center will also serve as a training incubator for emerging service innovations. Ally plans to beta-test its next-generation chatbot avatars that combine natural-language understanding with personalized financial coaching. By locating this experimental lab alongside live service operations, Ally can rapidly iterate on virtual support tools and seamlessly hand off complex cases to human advisors when needed.

The opening of the Brickell center underscores Allyâ€™s dedication to exceptional service, technological innovation, and community partnership. Through this new hub, the company aims to set a new standard for responsive, culturally attuned financial support across the Southeast and Latin-American corridors.
item.excerpt:encoded: In a bid to strengthen client support and reinforce its nationwide footprint, Ally Financial has inaugurated a state-of-the-art Customer Service Center in Miamiâ€™s Brickell neighborhood. The 20,000-square-foot facility, located on the 15th floor of a waterfront high-rise, will house over 300 customer service specialists dedicated to delivering personalized, omnichannel support for Allyâ€™s banking and auto finance customers.

item.title: Single Project
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
VelocityPay Dashboard: Expense Optimizer

BrightEdge Solutions partnered with NovaBank to transform their underperforming finance app. Cluttered screens and confusing navigation were driving users away. Our objective was a full UX/UI redesign to create a sleek, user-friendly interface that drives engagement and loyalty.

Client:

NovaBank Financial

Agency:

BrightEdge Solutions

Launch Date:

March 2024

Industry:

Digital Banking

Team Size:

12 UX Designers & Developers

Challenges

Complex menu structures and buried features frustrated users, leading to poor task completion and high drop-off. Onboarding lacked clarity, and personalization was non-existent.

Solutions

We simplified the navigation with a bottom tab bar and contextual shortcuts, reducing screens by 50%.

Introduced a step-by-step onboarding tour, increasing activation rate by 28%.

Built customizable dashboards so users can track goals and insights tailored to their financial habits.

50%

Fewer taps to complete tasks

28%

Rise in user activations

33%

Growth in daily logins

Design Process

Discovery: Conducted stakeholder workshops, user interviews, and data audits to map key pain points and usage patterns.

Architecture: Defined an intuitive content structure and prioritized primary actions for streamlined flows.

Prototyping: Built interactive wireframes in Figma, iterating based on usability feedback and A/B testing metrics.

Testing: Ran moderated sessions and remote unmoderated tests to validate task success rates and satisfaction scores.

Visual Design: Developed a modular component library with brand-consistent typography and color palettes, documented in a comprehensive style guide.

â€œVelocityPayâ€™s revitalized interface has empowered our users to make smarter financial decisions with ease. The intuitive design and personalized insights deliver real value every day.â€

Amelia Hart â€“ Head of Digital | NovaBank

Conclusion

The VelocityPay redesign significantly improved usability metricsâ€”reducing drop-off, boosting activation, and elevating user satisfactionâ€”demonstrating how strategic UX design drives business impact.
